alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 6:51PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, southern Tangipahoa and southwestern Washington Parishes through 730 PM CDT... At 651 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Independence, or 9 miles northeast of Hammond, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Independence, Madisonville, Folsom, Natalbany, Robert, Bush and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 40 and 61. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 35 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington
